A1 BANKRUPTCY'S HARD TIMES The lawyers, accountants and investment bankers who have made good livings working out the bad-debt cases of the 80's are about to face their worst fears: the bankruptcy business is going bust. A16 PRESSURE CONTINUES ON LAND DEAL Jim Leach, the leading Republican critic of the President's involvement in a failed Arkansas land venture, said that even if the Administration installed a special counsel to investigate, he would seek a separate Congressional inquiry. A16 NAVY ASSAILED ON TAILHOOK CASE A military court rejected the appeal of a Navy flier who is trying to avoid trial on charges that he was involved in the Tailhook affair. But the court criticized the Navy for an "amateurish approach" to the case. A16 CASH DEALS AND THE LAW The Supreme Court ruled that people who keep their cash transactions with banks under $10,000 to evade Federal reporting rules cannot be convicted without proof that they knew such action is illegal.
